Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gnome-documents
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome-documents, gnome-online-miners, libgepub bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: gnome-documents is a document manager application for GNOME, aiming to be a replacement for using GNOME Files to show the Documents directory. The gnome-online-miners package provides a set of crawlers that go through the users online content and index it locally in Tracker. It has miners for Facebook, Flick, Google, and SkyDrive. The libgepub library is a GObject based library for handling and rendering EPUB documents. The gnome-documents packages have been updated to version 3.22.2 and the gnome-online-miners packages to version 3.22.0. In addition, this update adds the libgepub library to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Users of gnome-documents, gnome-online-miners, and libgepub are advised to upgrade to these updated packages. For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Release Notes linked from the References section. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
